nodes.bodyText: Instead of excluding by package name, can we just disable the javadoc plugin for all samples?
I tried disabling the javadoc plugin <skip>true</skip> from the samples root directory; unfortunately it does not work.
You might have to do it on each individual sample?

Unfortunately it still does not work, there is something different about running this command from root versus in the individual directories. For example, when I applied the skip to the sample root, the samples get skipped when I run the javadoc command from the samples root, however it does not get skipped when running from project root.
What's the purpose of these links?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -216,6 +216,23 @@
 				<artifactId>appengine-maven-plugin</artifactId>
 				<version>${app-engine-maven-plugin.version}</version>
 			</plugin>
+			<plugin>
+				<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+				<artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
+				<configuration>
+					<excludePackageNames>
+						com.example,
+						com.example.*,
+						<!-- Exclude samples and classes in the Firestore Google Client library packages -->
+						com.google.cloud.firestore
+					</excludePackageNames>
+					<links>
+						<link>https://googleapis.dev/java/google-cloud-vision/latest/</link>

nodes.bodyText: It makes it so that any client library javadoc classes referenced in the spring-cloud-gcp javadoc will link successfully to the client library javadocs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -216,6 +216,23 @@
 				<artifactId>appengine-maven-plugin</artifactId>
 				<version>${app-engine-maven-plugin.version}</version>
 			</plugin>
+			<plugin>
+				<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+				<artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
+				<configuration>
+					<excludePackageNames>
+						com.example,
+						com.example.*,
+						<!-- Exclude samples and classes in the Firestore Google Client library packages -->
+						com.google.cloud.firestore
+					</excludePackageNames>
+					<links>
+						<link>https://googleapis.dev/java/google-cloud-vision/latest/</link>

nodes.bodyText: Cool! How do we know that we covered all of such references?
